channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Denmark's 'flexicurity' policies help get people back on their feet
item.description: If you lose your job in Denmark, it's not time to scream at the skies quite yet. The government has a unique set of policies called "flexicurity" designed to help get you back on your feet.
item.content:encoded: If you lose your job in Denmark, it's not time to scream at the skies quite yet. The government has a unique set of policies called "flexicurity" designed to help get you back on your feet.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: This expert watches shoppers like a hawk. Here's her holiday forecast
item.description: Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nation's future.
item.content:encoded:
Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nation's future.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Are toys more expensive? A look at prices this holiday season after tariff warnings
item.description: Earlier this year, toy makers said tariffs would put Christmas "at risk." NPR's A Martinez gets an update on the price of toys from Jay Foreman, CEO of Basic Fun.
item.content:encoded: Earlier this year, toy makers said tariffs would put Christmas "at risk." NPR's A Martinez gets an update on the price of toys from Jay Foreman, CEO of Basic Fun.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Retailers eye holiday shopping season as consumers tighten belts amid uncertainty
item.description: The holiday shopping season is here, but a lot of shoppers are more cautious about spending as the Trump administration pleads for patience on the economy.
item.content:encoded: The holiday shopping season is here, but a lot of shoppers are more cautious about spending as the Trump administration pleads for patience on the economy.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: The last Fed meeting of the year is approaching. Here's where we could be headed
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago about the economic outlook ahead of the last Fed meeting of the year.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago about the economic outlook ahead of the last Fed meeting of the year.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Some Wisconsin residents split on whether Trump helping or hurting economy
item.description: Many voters think the federal government should focus on lowering prices, including in the battleground state of Wisconsin, where some say they are concerned about the state of the economy.
item.content:encoded: Many voters think the federal government should focus on lowering prices, including in the battleground state of Wisconsin, where some say they are concerned about the state of the economy.
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: The U.S. produces a lot of food waste. This place wants to address it
item.description: Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.
item.content:encoded:
Even amid rising grocery prices and increased sensitivity to environmental issues, Americans still trash once-edible food at alarming rates.

(Image credit: Keren Carrion)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: New limits for rent algorithm that prosecutors say let landlords drive up prices
item.description: Landlords could no longer rely on rent-pricing software to quietly track each other's moves and push rents higher using confidential data, under a settlement between RealPage Inc. and federal prosecutors.
item.content:encoded:
Landlords could no longer rely on rent-pricing software to quietly track each other's moves and push rents higher using confidential data, under a settlement between RealPage Inc. and federal prosecutors.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 8 economic insights we're grateful for
item.description: For this Thanksgiving, Planet Money and The Indicator staffers offer economic insights they're grateful for.
item.content:encoded:
For this Thanksgiving, Planet Money and The Indicator staffers offer economic insights they're grateful for.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: We're shopping our feelings this Black Friday. Here are 3 things to know
item.description: Signs are pointing to deeper discounts this Black Friday, as stores try to coax anxious shoppers into splurging.
item.content:encoded:
Signs are pointing to deeper discounts this Black Friday, as stores try to coax anxious shoppers into splurging.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
